moves.2. Qh5: I went for a Queens Raid Opening.
moves.2... d6 3. Bc4 g6: My queen is forced to move.
moves.4. Qf3: I decided f3 was a good spot because it would still attack the f7 square.
moves.4... Nf6:
Black has now blocked my access to the f7 square completely.*

* Note: I could have moved Qb3 forming a battery to f7, but i found it to be a waste of tempo and the bishop would only check the king.
moves.7. O-O O-O 8. Qh3: I decided to get a Rook-Queen battery toward h7, after developing my rook.
moves.8... Nxe4 9. f4 exf4 10. Rxf4: I thought attacking the pawn would nicely place my rook.
moves.10... Nef6: I feared Nh6 which would block my battery-to-be.
moves.11. Qh6: So i went ahead and moved my queen.
moves.11... Kh8 12. Bxf7: I did this to block off the king access to g8 but...
moves.12... Rxf7: ... my move let his rook onto the 7th rank.
moves.13. Qh3: I moved back for another try at a battery.
moves.13... Ne5 14. Rh4:
The battery was set.*

* Note: I did not see the bishop at c8.
moves.14... Bxh3: Bxh3! I never saw it coming.
moves.15. Bg5 Ned7 16. Rxh3 Nd5 17. Nf4: I was flustered after Black took my queen and so i made this move.
moves.19. g3: I try to chase the rook away.
moves.20... Rd1+ 21. Kg2 Qf8: From here on out it's unstoppable checkmate.
moves.24... Qf3#:
Checkmate. 

Now i want this game to be remembered, because it has a valuable lesson to be learned. " Think before you move, Take your time, and keep on playing!"

Thanks for reading my annotation feel free to comment.
